abstract: Charles F Harris, editor and publisher who dedicated his career to bringing black writers and issues into literary and academic mainstream, dies at age 81.
lead_paragraph: He spent much of his career chipping away at the prevailing notion in the industry that writing by black authors or aimed at black readers belonged to a niche market.

headline.main: Charles F. Harris, 81, Dies; Led Effort to Publish Work by Black Writers
headline.print_headline: Charles F. Harris, 81, Dies; Championed Black Writers

snippet: He spent much of his career chipping away at the prevailing notion in the industry that writing by black authors or aimed at black readers belonged to a niche market.
